name: Santa Barbara Zoo Camp

pages.faq: Not found - policies likely in registration confirmation or Parent Handbook

data_hints.pricing_location: Reservation system page at reservations.sbzoo.org/Info.aspx?EventID=8. Pricing displayed for each camp type in card format with dates, hours, and prices
data_hints.hours_location: Reservation system - Half Day: 9 AM - 12 PM, Full Day: 9 AM - 3 PM

extended_care.name: Extended day option
extended_care.applies_to: Full Day Traditional Summer Camp only
extended_care.note: THIS IS THE AFTERCARE - $100/week extends the day from 3 PM to 5 PM

specialty_camps.name: Jr. Vet
specialty_camps.description: Live a week in the life of an exotic animal veterinarian when you visit the Zoo's animal hospital and practice medical procedures.

specialty_camps.name: Jr. Zookeeper
specialty_camps.description: Campers get to be a zookeeper for the week, and will assist staff in caring for some of the Zoo's exotic animals.

specialty_camps.name: Backyard Biologist
specialty_camps.schedule: Mon-Wed: 9 AM - 3 PM, Thu-Fri: 3:30 PM - 12 PM (OVERNIGHT)
specialty_camps.description: Train as a professional field biologist alongside the Zoo's conservation team and learn about sustainable stewardship practices.

data_hints.member_pricing: Yes - SB Zoo Members receive $50/week discount on most camp types

facilities.location: Santa Barbara Zoo, 500 Ninos Drive, Santa Barbara, CA 93103
facilities.setting: Outdoor zoo environment with indoor educational facilities
unique_features: Direct access to zoo animals and exhibits
Animal hospital access for Jr. Vet program

policies.food: Hot lunch available as add-on ($60/week), otherwise bring lunch
policies.transport: Not provided - drop-off and pick-up required

features.scholarship_fund: Nancy H. McToldridge Camp Scholarship Fund

registration.note: Registration for Summer Zoo Camp opens January 12, 2026

safari_sleepovers.description: Overnight camping at the zoo with s'mores, animal encounters, and breakfast

outdoor_education.note: Zoo Outdoor Ed and 'Zoo Camp' links on main site redirect to Peak2Pacific external partner

site_structure.cms: Custom CMS on main site, separate reservation system portal
site_structure.page_format: Main 'Learn' page links to /zoo-camp which REDIRECTS to external partner Peak2Pacific. Actual zoo camp registration and details are on reservations.sbzoo.org
site_structure.important_note: The /zoo-camp URL on sbzoo.org redirects externally to Peak2Pacific. The actual Zoo Camp operated by SB Zoo is found on the reservations portal.

scraper_hints.main_page_redirects: The URL https://www.sbzoo.org/zoo-camp redirects to https://www.peak2pacific.com/ - this is a DIFFERENT program
scraper_hints.pricing_format: Card-based layout with camp type headings, dates, hours, and prices
scraper_hints.sessions_format: Listed by camp type (Spring, Traditional Summer, Specialty)
scraper_hints.member_discount: $50/week - member pricing shown alongside regular pricing

special_notes: IMPORTANT: The SB Zoo website's /zoo-camp page redirects to Peak2Pacific (an external outdoor adventure partner program). The actual Santa Barbara Zoo Camp operated by the zoo is found ONLY on the reservation portal at reservations.sbzoo.org/Info.aspx?EventID=8. This is confusing for users. The zoo offers traditional day camps (half and full day) for ages 3-12, plus specialty camps (Jr. Vet, Jr. Zookeeper, Backyard Biologist) for ages 8-12. AFTERCARE IS AVAILABLE: Extended day option until 5 PM for $100/week on full-day traditional camps. Hot lunch is also an optional add-on for $60/week. Member pricing offers $50/week discount. The Nancy H. McToldridge Camp Scholarship Fund provides scholarships through Campership Alliance partnership. Safari Sleepovers are separate overnight programs available for families and groups.
